Lenarive is worried that another alien ecosystem like Exodor might threaten all existence.

So, she decided to create a series of educational cards detailing the world's ecology and environment.

The cards document creatures, resources, places, and notable people.

When a card is added to a collection, its owner gains special powers.

My name is Lenarive, and I am an ecosystem researcher.

You may not be aware of this, but our world is facing an ecological crisis at the moment, with creatures from outside the Dream popping up all over the place.

My colleagues and I are worried for the continued safety of our world's many wonderful creatures and historic locations."How can I help?"

I've decided to document the rich diversity of the Dream before it's too late.

Will you help me? There's nothing a simple researcher like myself can do to stop these incursions, but it would be my honor to help leave something for future ecologists."Tell me what to do."

I've created a way to store memories of your experiences, in to form of special cards that increase your connection to the Dream.

Hear, take this copy of my card binder. (You can access it through the 'My Character' menu.)

From now on, you'll earn card fragments when you defeat certain enemies, visit new places, or overcome specific challenges. When you have enough, you can assemble a card and place it in your binder. Your collection will become more powerful, and valuable, as you collect more and more fragments.

You can start by hunting Snuffling Warthogs. If you're lucky, you'll get a card fragment.

How did it go? Did you get a card fragment?

If you don't get one right away, don't be disappointed. They'll drop eventually. And you always have the option to purchase card fragments from other collectors through the brokerage."I'll keep that in mind."

You need 20 fragments of the same type to complete a card.

Once a card is completed, you'll be more in tune with the Dream and gain a bonus to your abilities."Thanks for the information."
Here. I'll give you 20 fragments for a Grazing Noruk card. Go ahead and add them to your collection. After you add them, you'll complete the card.
Once you complete a card, you can equip it and gain its listed bonuses to your abilities.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Bonuses?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

The Grazing Noruk card increases your Physical Resistance.

Equip the Grazing Noruk card, then fight a Grazing Noruk. You may not notice it right away, but you'll definitely see the difference in your stats.
Every card you complete can be helpful in various situations. Collect cards from around the world and use them wisely.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"I will."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

You can also trigger a Collection Effect when equipping specific cards.

The Grazing Noruk card I gave you has an effect called 'Long for Peace' which activates when you also have a Seir card equipped. Go talk to Commander Seir and obtain his card, then come talk to me again.

Lenarive's card collection? I'm aware of it. To be honest, I'm a little embarrased to be included in her roster of notable people. But at the same time, her work will help preserve the wonders of the Dream for future generations.

It would be extremely difficult for her to gather the cards herself. You should help her, if you can.."She said you'd give me your card."

Haha! What an honor!

Alright. Here you go. 20 fragments, right? Just don't tell anybody I did this for you.

Did you get Seir's card fragments?

Good. There are many people whose actions have made a lasting effect on the Dream. You'll find their fragments in all sorts of places from now on.

Now add Seir's card fragments to your collection and the 'Long for Peace' effect will unlock."I'll try."

Just like the Grazing Noruk card's resistance bonus, the 'Long for Peace' effect is effective against beasts.

Go to the second tab of your Card Collection window, activate the effect, and then fight a Grazing Noruk.

A remarkable display. You should be proud. I'm not exactly sure how many different collection effects there are, so you'll have to explore and experiment for me.

I'm counting on you to help preserve the Dream!
